intro: Beccariella aylapi, commonly known as the Aylapi beccariella, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
